text: XLII .
text_tokenized: XLII .

text: Had Elizabeth ’s opinion been all drawn from her own family , she could not have formed a very pleasing picture of conjugal felicity or domestic comfort .
text_tokenized: Had Elizabeth ’s opinion been all drawn from her own family , she could not have formed a very pleasing picture of conjugal felicity or domestic comfort .

text: Her father , captivated by youth and beauty , and that appearance of good - humour which youth and beauty generally give , had married a woman whose weak understanding and illiberal mind had very early in their marriage put an end to all real affection for her .
text_tokenized: Her father , captivated by youth and beauty , and that appearance of good - humour which youth and beauty generally give , had married a woman whose weak understanding and illiberal mind had very early in their marriage put an end to all real affection for her .

text: Respect , esteem , and confidence had vanished for ever ; and all his views of domestic happiness were overthrown .
text_tokenized: Respect , esteem , and confidence had vanished for ever ; and all his views of domestic happiness were overthrown .

text: But Mr. Bennet was not of a disposition to seek comfort for the disappointment which his own imprudence had brought on in any of those pleasures which too often console the unfortunate for their folly or their vice .
text_tokenized: But Mr. Bennet was not of a disposition to seek comfort for the disappointment which his own imprudence had brought on in any of those pleasures which too often console the unfortunate for their folly or their vice .

text: He was fond of the country and of books ; and from these tastes had arisen his principal enjoyments .
text_tokenized: He was fond of the country and of books ; and from these tastes had arisen his principal enjoyments .

text: To his wife he was very little otherwise indebted than as her ignorance and folly had contributed to his amusement .
text_tokenized: To his wife he was very little otherwise indebted than as her ignorance and folly had contributed to his amusement .

text: This is not the sort of happiness which a man would in general wish to owe to his wife ; but where other powers of entertainment are wanting , the true philosopher will derive benefit from such as are given .
text_tokenized: This is not the sort of happiness which a man would in general wish to owe to his wife ; but where other powers of entertainment are wanting , the true philosopher will derive benefit from such as are given .

text: Elizabeth , however , had never been blind to the impropriety of her father ’s behaviour as a husband .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , however , had never been blind to the impropriety of her father ’s behaviour as a husband .

text: She had always seen it with pain ; but respecting his abilities , and grateful for his affectionate treatment of herself , she endeavoured to forget what she could not overlook , and to
text_tokenized: She had always seen it with pain ; but respecting his abilities , and grateful for his affectionate treatment of herself , she endeavoured to forget what she could not overlook , and to

text: banish from her thoughts that continual breach of conjugal obligation and decorum which , in exposing his wife to the contempt of her own children , was so highly reprehensible .
text_tokenized: banish from her thoughts that continual breach of conjugal obligation and decorum which , in exposing his wife to the contempt of her own children , was so highly reprehensible .

text: But she had never felt so strongly as now the disadvantages which must attend the children of so unsuitable a marriage , nor ever been so fully aware of the evils arising from so ill - judged a direction of talents -- talents which , rightly used , might at least have preserved the respectability of his daughters , even if incapable of enlarging the mind of his wife .
text_tokenized: But she had never felt so strongly as now the disadvantages which must attend the children of so unsuitable a marriage , nor ever been so fully aware of the evils arising from so ill - judged a direction of talents -- talents which , rightly used , might at least have preserved the respectability of his daughters , even if incapable of enlarging the mind of his wife .

text: When Elizabeth had rejoiced over Wickham ’s departure , she found little other cause for satisfaction in the loss of the regiment .
text_tokenized: When Elizabeth had rejoiced over Wickham ’s departure , she found little other cause for satisfaction in the loss of the regiment .

text: Their parties abroad were less varied than before ; and at home she had a mother and sister , whose constant repinings at the dulness of everything around them threw a real gloom over their domestic circle ;
text_tokenized: Their parties abroad were less varied than before ; and at home she had a mother and sister , whose constant repinings at the dulness of everything around them threw a real gloom over their domestic circle ;

text: and , though Kitty might in time regain her natural degree of sense , since the disturbers of her brain were removed , her other sister , from whose disposition greater evil might be apprehended , was likely to be hardened in all her folly and assurance , by a situation of such double danger as a watering - place and a camp .
text_tokenized: and , though Kitty might in time regain her natural degree of sense , since the disturbers of her brain were removed , her other sister , from whose disposition greater evil might be apprehended , was likely to be hardened in all her folly and assurance , by a situation of such double danger as a watering - place and a camp .

text: Upon the whole , therefore , she found , what has been sometimes found before , that an event to which she had looked forward with impatient desire , did not , in taking place , bring all the satisfaction she had promised herself .
text_tokenized: Upon the whole , therefore , she found , what has been sometimes found before , that an event to which she had looked forward with impatient desire , did not , in taking place , bring all the satisfaction she had promised herself .

text: It was consequently necessary to name some other period for the commencement of actual felicity ; to have some other point on which her wishes and hopes might be fixed , and by again enjoying the pleasure of anticipation , console herself for the present , and prepare for another disappointment .
text_tokenized: It was consequently necessary to name some other period for the commencement of actual felicity ; to have some other point on which her wishes and hopes might be fixed , and by again enjoying the pleasure of anticipation , console herself for the present , and prepare for another disappointment .

text: Her tour to the Lakes was now the object of her happiest thoughts : it was her best consolation for all the uncomfortable hours which the discontentedness of her mother and Kitty made inevitable ; and could she have included Jane in the scheme , every part of it would have been perfect . “ But it is fortunate , ” thought she , “ that I have something to wish for .
text_tokenized: Her tour to the Lakes was now the object of her happiest thoughts : it was her best consolation for all the uncomfortable hours which the discontentedness of her mother and Kitty made inevitable ; and could she have included Jane in the scheme , every part of it would have been perfect . “ But it is fortunate , ” thought she , “ that I have something to wish for .

text: Were the whole arrangement complete , my disappointment would be certain .
text_tokenized: Were the whole arrangement complete , my disappointment would be certain .

text: But here , by carrying with me one ceaseless source of regret in my sister ’s absence , I may reasonably hope to have all my expectations of pleasure realized .
text_tokenized: But here , by carrying with me one ceaseless source of regret in my sister ’s absence , I may reasonably hope to have all my expectations of pleasure realized .

text: A scheme of which every part promises delight can never be successful ; and general disappointment is only warded off by the defence of some little peculiar vexation .
text_tokenized: A scheme of which every part promises delight can never be successful ; and general disappointment is only warded off by the defence of some little peculiar vexation .

text: ” When Lydia went away she promised to write very often and very minutely to her mother and Kitty ; but her letters were always long expected , and always very short .
text_tokenized: ” When Lydia went away she promised to write very often and very minutely to her mother and Kitty ; but her letters were always long expected , and always very short .

text: Those to her mother contained little else than that they were just returned from the library , where such and such officers had attended them , and where she had seen such beautiful ornaments as made her quite wild ; that she had a new gown , or a new parasol , which she would have described more fully , but was obliged to leave off in a violent hurry , as Mrs. Forster called her , and they were going to the camp ; and from her correspondence with her sister there was still less to be learnt , for her letters to Kitty , though rather longer , were much too full of lines under the words to be made public .
text_tokenized: Those to her mother contained little else than that they were just returned from the library , where such and such officers had attended them , and where she had seen such beautiful ornaments as made her quite wild ; that she had a new gown , or a new parasol , which she would have described more fully , but was obliged to leave off in a violent hurry , as Mrs. Forster called her , and they were going to the camp ; and from her correspondence with her sister there was still less to be learnt , for her letters to Kitty , though rather longer , were much too full of lines under the words to be made public .

text: After the first fortnight or three weeks of her absence , health , good - humour , and cheerfulness began to reappear at Longbourn .
text_tokenized: After the first fortnight or three weeks of her absence , health , good - humour , and cheerfulness began to reappear at Longbourn .

text: Everything wore a happier aspect .
text_tokenized: Everything wore a happier aspect .

text: The families who had been in town for the winter came back again , and summer finery and summer engagements arose .
text_tokenized: The families who had been in town for the winter came back again , and summer finery and summer engagements arose .

text: Mrs. Bennet was restored to her usual querulous serenity ; and by the middle of June Kitty was so much recovered as to be able to enter Meryton without tears,--an event of such happy promise as to make Elizabeth hope , that by the following Christmas she might be so tolerably reasonable as not to mention an officer above once a day , unless , by some cruel and malicious arrangement at the War Office , another regiment should be quartered in Meryton .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet was restored to her usual querulous serenity ; and by the middle of June Kitty was so much recovered as to be able to enter Meryton without tears,--an event of such happy promise as to make Elizabeth hope , that by the following Christmas she might be so tolerably reasonable as not to mention an officer above once a day , unless , by some cruel and malicious arrangement at the War Office , another regiment should be quartered in Meryton .

text: The time fixed for the beginning of their northern tour was now fast approaching ; and a fortnight only was wanting of it , when a letter arrived from Mrs. Gardiner , which at once delayed its commencement and curtailed its extent .
text_tokenized: The time fixed for the beginning of their northern tour was now fast approaching ; and a fortnight only was wanting of it , when a letter arrived from Mrs. Gardiner , which at once delayed its commencement and curtailed its extent .

text: Mr. Gardiner would be prevented by business from setting out till a fortnight later in July , and must be in London again within a month ; and as that left too short a period for them to go so far , and see so much as they had proposed , or at least to see it with the leisure and comfort they had built on , they were obliged to give up the Lakes , and substitute a more contracted tour ; and , according to the present plan , were to go no farther northward than Derbyshire .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner would be prevented by business from setting out till a fortnight later in July , and must be in London again within a month ; and as that left too short a period for them to go so far , and see so much as they had proposed , or at least to see it with the leisure and comfort they had built on , they were obliged to give up the Lakes , and substitute a more contracted tour ; and , according to the present plan , were to go no farther northward than Derbyshire .

text: In that county there was enough to be seen to occupy the chief of their three weeks ; and to Mrs. Gardiner it had a peculiarly strong attraction .
text_tokenized: In that county there was enough to be seen to occupy the chief of their three weeks ; and to Mrs. Gardiner it had a peculiarly strong attraction .

text: The town where she had formerly passed some years of her life , and where they were now to spend a few days , was probably as great an object of her curiosity as all the celebrated beauties of Matlock , Chatsworth , Dovedale , or the Peak .
text_tokenized: The town where she had formerly passed some years of her life , and where they were now to spend a few days , was probably as great an object of her curiosity as all the celebrated beauties of Matlock , Chatsworth , Dovedale , or the Peak .

text: Elizabeth was excessively disappointed : she had set her heart on seeing the Lakes ; and still thought there might have been time enough .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was excessively disappointed : she had set her heart on seeing the Lakes ; and still thought there might have been time enough .

text: But it was her business to be satisfied -- and certainly her temper to be happy ; and all was soon right again .
text_tokenized: But it was her business to be satisfied -- and certainly her temper to be happy ; and all was soon right again .

text: With the mention of Derbyshire , there were many ideas connected .
text_tokenized: With the mention of Derbyshire , there were many ideas connected .

text: It was impossible for her to see the word without thinking of Pemberley and its owner .
text_tokenized: It was impossible for her to see the word without thinking of Pemberley and its owner .

text: “ But surely , ” said she , “ I may enter his county with impunity , and rob it of a few petrified spars , without his perceiving me .
text_tokenized: “ But surely , ” said she , “ I may enter his county with impunity , and rob it of a few petrified spars , without his perceiving me .

text: The period of expectation was now doubled .
text_tokenized: The period of expectation was now doubled .

text: Four weeks were to pass away before her uncle and aunt ’s arrival .
text_tokenized: Four weeks were to pass away before her uncle and aunt ’s arrival .

text: But they did pass away , and Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner , with their four children , did at length appear at Longbourn .
text_tokenized: But they did pass away , and Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner , with their four children , did at length appear at Longbourn .

text: The children , two girls of six and eight years old , and two younger boys , were to be left under the particular care of their cousin Jane , who was the general favourite , and whose steady sense and sweetness of temper exactly adapted her for attending to them in every way -- teaching them , playing with them , and loving them .
text_tokenized: The children , two girls of six and eight years old , and two younger boys , were to be left under the particular care of their cousin Jane , who was the general favourite , and whose steady sense and sweetness of temper exactly adapted her for attending to them in every way -- teaching them , playing with them , and loving them .

text: The Gardiners stayed only one night at Longbourn , and set off the next morning with Elizabeth in pursuit of novelty and amusement .
text_tokenized: The Gardiners stayed only one night at Longbourn , and set off the next morning with Elizabeth in pursuit of novelty and amusement .

text: One enjoyment was certain -- that of suitableness as companions ; a suitableness which comprehended health and temper to bear inconveniences -- cheerfulness to enhance every pleasure -- and affection and intelligence , which might supply it among themselves if there were disappointments abroad .
text_tokenized: One enjoyment was certain -- that of suitableness as companions ; a suitableness which comprehended health and temper to bear inconveniences -- cheerfulness to enhance every pleasure -- and affection and intelligence , which might supply it among themselves if there were disappointments abroad .

text: It is not the object of this work to give a description of Derbyshire , nor of any of the remarkable places through which their route thither lay -- Oxford , Blenheim , Warwick , Kenilworth , Birmingham , etc . , are sufficiently known .
text_tokenized: It is not the object of this work to give a description of Derbyshire , nor of any of the remarkable places through which their route thither lay -- Oxford , Blenheim , Warwick , Kenilworth , Birmingham , etc . , are sufficiently known .

text: A small part of Derbyshire is all the present concern .
text_tokenized: A small part of Derbyshire is all the present concern .

text: To the little town of Lambton , the scene of Mrs. Gardiner ’s former residence , and where she had lately learned that some acquaintance still remained , they bent their steps , after having seen all the principal wonders of the country ; and within five miles of Lambton , Elizabeth found , from her aunt , that Pemberley was situated .
text_tokenized: To the little town of Lambton , the scene of Mrs. Gardiner ’s former residence , and where she had lately learned that some acquaintance still remained , they bent their steps , after having seen all the principal wonders of the country ; and within five miles of Lambton , Elizabeth found , from her aunt , that Pemberley was situated .

text: It was not in their direct road ; nor more than a mile or two out of it .
text_tokenized: It was not in their direct road ; nor more than a mile or two out of it .

text: In talking over their route the evening before , Mrs. Gardiner expressed an inclination to see the place again .
text_tokenized: In talking over their route the evening before , Mrs. Gardiner expressed an inclination to see the place again .

text: Mr. Gardiner declared his willingness , and Elizabeth was applied to for her approbation .
text_tokenized: Mr. Gardiner declared his willingness , and Elizabeth was applied to for her approbation .

text: “ My love , should not you like to see a place of which you have heard so much ? ” said her aunt .
text_tokenized: “ My love , should not you like to see a place of which you have heard so much ? ” said her aunt .

text: “ A place , too , with which so many of your acquaintance are connected .
text_tokenized: “ A place , too , with which so many of your acquaintance are connected .

text: Wickham passed all his youth there , you know . ”
text_tokenized: Wickham passed all his youth there , you know . ”

text: Elizabeth was distressed .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was distressed .

text: She felt that she had no business at Pemberley , and was obliged to assume a disinclination for seeing it .
text_tokenized: She felt that she had no business at Pemberley , and was obliged to assume a disinclination for seeing it .

text: She must own that she was tired of great houses : after going over so many , she really had no pleasure in fine carpets or satin curtains .
text_tokenized: She must own that she was tired of great houses : after going over so many , she really had no pleasure in fine carpets or satin curtains .

text: Mrs. Gardiner abused her stupidity .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner abused her stupidity .

text: “ If it were merely a fine house richly furnished
text_tokenized: “ If it were merely a fine house richly furnished

text: , ” said she , “ I should not care about it myself ; but the grounds are delightful .
text_tokenized: , ” said she , “ I should not care about it myself ; but the grounds are delightful .

text: They have some of the finest woods in the country . ”
text_tokenized: They have some of the finest woods in the country . ”

text: Elizabeth said no more ; but her mind could not acquiesce .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth said no more ; but her mind could not acquiesce .

text: The possibility of meeting Mr. Darcy , while viewing the place , instantly occurred .
text_tokenized: The possibility of meeting Mr. Darcy , while viewing the place , instantly occurred .

text: It would be dreadful !
text_tokenized: It would be dreadful !

text: She blushed at the very idea ; and thought it would be better to speak openly to her aunt , than to run such a risk .
text_tokenized: She blushed at the very idea ; and thought it would be better to speak openly to her aunt , than to run such a risk .

text: But against this there were objections ; and she finally resolved that it could be the last resource , if her private inquiries as to the absence of the family were unfavourably answered .
text_tokenized: But against this there were objections ; and she finally resolved that it could be the last resource , if her private inquiries as to the absence of the family were unfavourably answered .

text: Accordingly , when she retired at night , she asked the chambermaid whether Pemberley were not a very fine place , what was the name of its proprietor , and , with no little alarm , whether the family were down for the summer ?
text_tokenized: Accordingly , when she retired at night , she asked the chambermaid whether Pemberley were not a very fine place , what was the name of its proprietor , and , with no little alarm , whether the family were down for the summer ?

text: A most welcome negative followed the last question ; and her alarms being now removed , she was at leisure to feel a great deal of curiosity to see the house herself ; and when the subject was revived the next morning , and she was again applied to , could readily answer , and with a proper air of indifference , that she had not really any dislike to the scheme .
text_tokenized: A most welcome negative followed the last question ; and her alarms being now removed , she was at leisure to feel a great deal of curiosity to see the house herself ; and when the subject was revived the next morning , and she was again applied to , could readily answer , and with a proper air of indifference , that she had not really any dislike to the scheme .

text: To Pemberley , therefore , they were to go .
text_tokenized: To Pemberley , therefore , they were to go .

text: XLIII .
text_tokenized: XLIII .

text: Elizabeth , as they drove along , watched for the first appearance of Pemberley Woods with some perturbation ; and when at length they turned in at the lodge , her spirits were in a high flutter . The park was very large , and contained great variety of ground .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , as they drove along , watched for the first appearance of Pemberley Woods with some perturbation ; and when at length they turned in at the lodge , her spirits were in a high flutter . The park was very large , and contained great variety of ground .

text: They entered it in one of its lowest points , and drove for some time through a beautiful wood stretching over a wide extent .
text_tokenized: They entered it in one of its lowest points , and drove for some time through a beautiful wood stretching over a wide extent .

text: Elizabeth ’s mind was too full for conversation , but she saw and admired every remarkable spot and point of view .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth ’s mind was too full for conversation , but she saw and admired every remarkable spot and point of view .

text: They gradually ascended for half a mile , and then found themselves at the top of a considerable eminence , where the wood ceased , and the eye was instantly caught by Pemberley House , situated on the opposite side of the valley , into which the road with some abruptness wound .
text_tokenized: They gradually ascended for half a mile , and then found themselves at the top of a considerable eminence , where the wood ceased , and the eye was instantly caught by Pemberley House , situated on the opposite side of the valley , into which the road with some abruptness wound .

text: It was a large , handsome stone building , standing well on rising ground , and backed by a ridge of high woody hills ; and in front a stream of some natural importance was swelled into greater , but without any artificial appearance .
text_tokenized: It was a large , handsome stone building , standing well on rising ground , and backed by a ridge of high woody hills ; and in front a stream of some natural importance was swelled into greater , but without any artificial appearance .

text: Its banks were neither formal nor falsely adorned .
text_tokenized: Its banks were neither formal nor falsely adorned .

text: Elizabeth was delighted .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was delighted .

text: She had never seen a place for which nature had done more , or where natural beauty had been so little counteracted by an awkward taste .
text_tokenized: She had never seen a place for which nature had done more , or where natural beauty had been so little counteracted by an awkward taste .

text: They were all of them warm in their admiration ; and at that moment she felt that to be mistress of Pemberley might be something ! They descended the hill , crossed the bridge , and drove to the door ; and , while examining the nearer aspect of the house , all her apprehension of meeting its owner returned .
text_tokenized: They were all of them warm in their admiration ; and at that moment she felt that to be mistress of Pemberley might be something ! They descended the hill , crossed the bridge , and drove to the door ; and , while examining the nearer aspect of the house , all her apprehension of meeting its owner returned .

text: She dreaded lest the chambermaid had been mistaken .
text_tokenized: She dreaded lest the chambermaid had been mistaken .

text: On applying to see the place , they were admitted into the hall ; and Elizabeth , as they waited for the housekeeper , had leisure to wonder at her being where she was .
text_tokenized: On applying to see the place , they were admitted into the hall ; and Elizabeth , as they waited for the housekeeper , had leisure to wonder at her being where she was .

text: The housekeeper came ; a respectable looking elderly woman , much less fine , and more civil , than she had any notion of finding her .
text_tokenized: The housekeeper came ; a respectable looking elderly woman , much less fine , and more civil , than she had any notion of finding her .

text: They followed her into the dining - parlour .
text_tokenized: They followed her into the dining - parlour .

text: It was a large , well - proportioned room , handsomely fitted up .
text_tokenized: It was a large , well - proportioned room , handsomely fitted up .

text: Elizabeth , after slightly surveying it , went to a window to enjoy its prospect .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , after slightly surveying it , went to a window to enjoy its prospect .

text: The hill , crowned with wood , from which they had descended , receiving increased abruptness from the distance , was a beautiful object .
text_tokenized: The hill , crowned with wood , from which they had descended , receiving increased abruptness from the distance , was a beautiful object .

text: Every disposition of the ground was good ; and she looked on the whole scene , the river , the trees scattered on its banks , and the winding of the valley , as far as she could trace it , with delight .
text_tokenized: Every disposition of the ground was good ; and she looked on the whole scene , the river , the trees scattered on its banks , and the winding of the valley , as far as she could trace it , with delight .

text: As
text_tokenized: As

text: they
text_tokenized: they

text: passed into other rooms
text_tokenized: passed into other rooms

text: , these objects were taking different positions ; but from every window there were beauties to be seen .
text_tokenized: , these objects were taking different positions ; but from every window there were beauties to be seen .

text: The rooms were lofty and handsome , and their furniture suitable to the fortune of their proprietor ; but Elizabeth saw , with admiration of his taste , that it was neither gaudy nor uselessly fine,--with less of splendour , and more real elegance , than the furniture of Rosings . “ And of this place , ” thought she , “ I might have been mistress !
text_tokenized: The rooms were lofty and handsome , and their furniture suitable to the fortune of their proprietor ; but Elizabeth saw , with admiration of his taste , that it was neither gaudy nor uselessly fine,--with less of splendour , and more real elegance , than the furniture of Rosings . “ And of this place , ” thought she , “ I might have been mistress !

text: With these rooms I might have now been familiarly acquainted !
text_tokenized: With these rooms I might have now been familiarly acquainted !

text: Instead of viewing them as a stranger , I might have rejoiced in them as my own , and welcomed to them as visitors my uncle and aunt .
text_tokenized: Instead of viewing them as a stranger , I might have rejoiced in them as my own , and welcomed to them as visitors my uncle and aunt .

text: But , no , ” recollecting herself , “ that could never be ; my uncle and aunt would have been lost to me ; I should not have been allowed to invite them .
text_tokenized: But , no , ” recollecting herself , “ that could never be ; my uncle and aunt would have been lost to me ; I should not have been allowed to invite them .

text: This was a lucky recollection -- it saved her from something like regret .
text_tokenized: This was a lucky recollection -- it saved her from something like regret .

text: She longed to inquire of the housekeeper whether her master were really absent , but had not courage for it .
text_tokenized: She longed to inquire of the housekeeper whether her master were really absent , but had not courage for it .

text: At length , however , the question was asked by her uncle ; and she turned away with alarm , while Mrs. Reynolds replied , that he was ; adding , “ But we expect him to - morrow , with a large party of friends . ”
text_tokenized: At length , however , the question was asked by her uncle ; and she turned away with alarm , while Mrs. Reynolds replied , that he was ; adding , “ But we expect him to - morrow , with a large party of friends . ”

text: How rejoiced was Elizabeth that their own journey had not by any circumstance been delayed a day !
text_tokenized: How rejoiced was Elizabeth that their own journey had not by any circumstance been delayed a day !

text: Her aunt now called her to look at a picture .
text_tokenized: Her aunt now called her to look at a picture .

text: She approached , and saw the likeness of Mr. Wickham , suspended , amongst several other miniatures , over the mantel - piece . Her aunt asked her , smilingly , how she liked it .
text_tokenized: She approached , and saw the likeness of Mr. Wickham , suspended , amongst several other miniatures , over the mantel - piece . Her aunt asked her , smilingly , how she liked it .

text: The housekeeper came forward , and told them it was the picture of a young gentleman , the son of her late master ’s steward , who had been brought up by him at his own expense .
text_tokenized: The housekeeper came forward , and told them it was the picture of a young gentleman , the son of her late master ’s steward , who had been brought up by him at his own expense .

text: “ He is now gone into the army , ” she added ; “ but I am afraid he has turned out very wild . ”
text_tokenized: “ He is now gone into the army , ” she added ; “ but I am afraid he has turned out very wild . ”

text: Mrs. Gardiner looked at her niece with a smile , but Elizabeth could not return it .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner looked at her niece with a smile , but Elizabeth could not return it .

text: “ And that , ” said Mrs. Reynolds , pointing to another of the miniatures , “ is my master -- and very like him .
text_tokenized: “ And that , ” said Mrs. Reynolds , pointing to another of the miniatures , “ is my master -- and very like him .

text: It was drawn at the same time as the other -- about eight years ago . ”
text_tokenized: It was drawn at the same time as the other -- about eight years ago . ”

text: “ I have heard much of your master ’s fine person , ” said Mrs. Gardiner , looking at the picture ; “ it is a handsome face .
text_tokenized: “ I have heard much of your master ’s fine person , ” said Mrs. Gardiner , looking at the picture ; “ it is a handsome face .

text: But , Lizzy , you can tell us whether it is like or not . ”
text_tokenized: But , Lizzy , you can tell us whether it is like or not . ”

text: Mrs. Reynolds ’ respect for Elizabeth seemed to increase on this intimation of her knowing her master .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Reynolds ’ respect for Elizabeth seemed to increase on this intimation of her knowing her master .

text: “ Does that young lady know Mr. Darcy ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Does that young lady know Mr. Darcy ? ”

text: Elizabeth coloured , and said , “ A little . ” “ And do not you think him a very handsome gentleman , ma’am ? ” “ Yes , very handsome . ” “ I am sure _ I _ know none so handsome ; but in the gallery upstairs you will see a finer , larger picture of him than this .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth coloured , and said , “ A little . ” “ And do not you think him a very handsome gentleman , ma’am ? ” “ Yes , very handsome . ” “ I am sure _ I _ know none so handsome ; but in the gallery upstairs you will see a finer , larger picture of him than this .

text: This room was my late master ’s favourite room , and these miniatures are just as they used to be then .
text_tokenized: This room was my late master ’s favourite room , and these miniatures are just as they used to be then .

text: He was very fond of them .
text_tokenized: He was very fond of them .

text: This accounted to Elizabeth for Mr. Wickham ’s being among them .
text_tokenized: This accounted to Elizabeth for Mr. Wickham ’s being among them .

text: Mrs. Reynolds then directed their attention to one of Miss Darcy , drawn when she was only eight years old .

text: “ And is Miss Darcy as handsome as her brother ? ” said Mr. Gardiner .

text_tokenized: From what can it proceed ?

text: It can not be for _ me _ , it can not be for _ my _ sake that his manners are thus softened .
text_tokenized: It can not be for _ me _ , it can not be for _ my _ sake that his manners are thus softened .

text: My reproofs at Hunsford could not work such a change as this .
text_tokenized: My reproofs at Hunsford could not work such a change as this .

text: It is impossible that he should still love me . ” After walking some time in this way , the two ladies in front , the two gentlemen behind , on resuming their places , after descending to the brink of the river for the better inspection of some curious water - plant , there chanced to be a little alteration .
text_tokenized: It is impossible that he should still love me . ” After walking some time in this way , the two ladies in front , the two gentlemen behind , on resuming their places , after descending to the brink of the river for the better inspection of some curious water - plant , there chanced to be a little alteration .

text: It originated in Mrs. Gardiner , who , fatigued by the exercise of the morning , found Elizabeth ’s arm inadequate to her support , and consequently preferred her husband ’s .
text_tokenized: It originated in Mrs. Gardiner , who , fatigued by the exercise of the morning , found Elizabeth ’s arm inadequate to her support , and consequently preferred her husband ’s .

text: Mr. Darcy took her place by her niece , and they walked on together .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy took her place by her niece , and they walked on together .

text: After a short silence the lady first spoke .
text_tokenized: After a short silence the lady first spoke .

text: She wished him to know that she had been assured of his absence before she came to the place , and accordingly began by observing , that his arrival had been very unexpected--“for your housekeeper , ” she added , “ informed us that you would certainly not be here till to - morrow ; and , indeed , before we left Bakewell , we understood that you were not immediately expected in
text_tokenized: She wished him to know that she had been assured of his absence before she came to the place , and accordingly began by observing , that his arrival had been very unexpected--“for your housekeeper , ” she added , “ informed us that you would certainly not be here till to - morrow ; and , indeed , before we left Bakewell , we understood that you were not immediately expected in

text: the country
text_tokenized: the country

text: He acknowledged the truth of it all ; and said that business with his steward had occasioned his coming forward a few hours before the rest of the party with whom he had been travelling .
text_tokenized: He acknowledged the truth of it all ; and said that business with his steward had occasioned his coming forward a few hours before the rest of the party with whom he had been travelling .

text: “ They will join me early to - morrow , ” he continued , “ and among them are some who will claim an acquaintance with you,--Mr . Bingley and his sisters . ”
text_tokenized: “ They will join me early to - morrow , ” he continued , “ and among them are some who will claim an acquaintance with you,--Mr . Bingley and his sisters . ”

text: Elizabeth answered only by a slight bow .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth answered only by a slight bow .

text: Her thoughts were instantly driven back to the time when Mr. Bingley ’s name had been last mentioned between them ; and if she might judge from his complexion , _ his _ mind was not very differently engaged .
text_tokenized: Her thoughts were instantly driven back to the time when Mr. Bingley ’s name had been last mentioned between them ; and if she might judge from his complexion , _ his _ mind was not very differently engaged .

text: “ There is also one other person in the party , ” he continued after a pause , “ who more particularly wishes to be known to you .
text_tokenized: “ There is also one other person in the party , ” he continued after a pause , “ who more particularly wishes to be known to you .

text: Will you allow me , or do I ask too much , to introduce my sister to your acquaintance during your stay at Lambton ? ”
text_tokenized: Will you allow me , or do I ask too much , to introduce my sister to your acquaintance during your stay at Lambton ? ”

text: The surprise of such an application was great indeed ; it was too great for her to know in what manner she acceded to it .
text_tokenized: The surprise of such an application was great indeed ; it was too great for her to know in what manner she acceded to it .

text: She immediately felt that whatever desire Miss Darcy might have of being acquainted with her , must be the work of her brother , and without looking farther , it was satisfactory ; it was gratifying to know that his resentment had not made him think really ill of her .
text_tokenized: She immediately felt that whatever desire Miss Darcy might have of being acquainted with her , must be the work of her brother , and without looking farther , it was satisfactory ; it was gratifying to know that his resentment had not made him think really ill of her .

text: They now walked on in silence ; each of them deep in thought .
text_tokenized: They now walked on in silence ; each of them deep in thought .

text: Elizabeth was not comfortable ; that was impossible ; but she was flattered and pleased .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was not comfortable ; that was impossible ; but she was flattered and pleased .

text: His wish of introducing his sister to her was a compliment of the highest kind .
text_tokenized: His wish of introducing his sister to her was a compliment of the highest kind .

text: They soon outstripped the others ; and when they had reached the carriage , Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner were half a quarter of a mile behind .
text_tokenized: They soon outstripped the others ; and when they had reached the carriage , Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner were half a quarter of a mile behind .

text: He then asked her to walk into the house -- but she declared herself not tired , and they stood together on the lawn .
text_tokenized: He then asked her to walk into the house -- but she declared herself not tired , and they stood together on the lawn .

text: At such a time much might have been said , and silence was very awkward .
text_tokenized: At such a time much might have been said , and silence was very awkward .

text: She wanted to talk , but there seemed an embargo on every subject .
text_tokenized: She wanted to talk , but there seemed an embargo on every subject .

text: At last she recollected that she had been travelling , and they talked of Matlock and Dovedale with great perseverance .
text_tokenized: At last she recollected that she had been travelling , and they talked of Matlock and Dovedale with great perseverance .

text: Yet time and her aunt moved slowly -- and her patience and her ideas were nearly worn out before the _ tête - à - tête _ was over .
text_tokenized: Yet time and her aunt moved slowly -- and her patience and her ideas were nearly worn out before the _ tête - à - tête _ was over .

text: On Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner ’s coming up they were all pressed to go into the house and take some refreshment ; but this was declined , and they parted on each side with the utmost politeness .
text_tokenized: On Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner ’s coming up they were all pressed to go into the house and take some refreshment ; but this was declined , and they parted on each side with the utmost politeness .

text: Mr. Darcy handed the ladies into the carriage ; and when it drove off , Elizabeth saw him walking slowly towards the house .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy handed the ladies into the carriage ; and when it drove off , Elizabeth saw him walking slowly towards the house .

text: The observations of her uncle and aunt now began ; and each of them pronounced him to be infinitely superior to anything they had expected .
text_tokenized: The observations of her uncle and aunt now began ; and each of them pronounced him to be infinitely superior to anything they had expected .

text: “ He is perfectly well - behaved , polite , and unassuming , ” said her uncle . “ There _ is _ something a little stately in him , to be sure , ” replied her aunt ; “ but it is confined to his air , and is not unbecoming .
text_tokenized: “ He is perfectly well - behaved , polite , and unassuming , ” said her uncle . “ There _ is _ something a little stately in him , to be sure , ” replied her aunt ; “ but it is confined to his air , and is not unbecoming .

text: I can now say with the housekeeper , that though some people may call him proud , _ I _ have seen nothing of it . ”
text_tokenized: I can now say with the housekeeper , that though some people may call him proud , _ I _ have seen nothing of it . ”

text: “ I was never more surprised than by his behaviour to us .
text_tokenized: “ I was never more surprised than by his behaviour to us .

text: It was more than civil ; it was really attentive ; and there was no necessity for such attention .
text_tokenized: It was more than civil ; it was really attentive ; and there was no necessity for such attention .

text: His acquaintance with Elizabeth was very trifling . ”
text_tokenized: His acquaintance with Elizabeth was very trifling . ”

text: “ To be sure , Lizzy , ” said her aunt , “ he is not so handsome as Wickham ; or rather he has not Wickham ’s countenance , for his features are perfectly good .
text_tokenized: “ To be sure , Lizzy , ” said her aunt , “ he is not so handsome as Wickham ; or rather he has not Wickham ’s countenance , for his features are perfectly good .

text: But how came you to tell us that he was so disagreeable ?
text_tokenized: But how came you to tell us that he was so disagreeable ?

text: ” Elizabeth excused herself as well as she could : said that she had liked him better when they met in Kent than before , and that she had never seen him so pleasant as this morning .
text_tokenized: ” Elizabeth excused herself as well as she could : said that she had liked him better when they met in Kent than before , and that she had never seen him so pleasant as this morning .

text: “ But perhaps he may be a little whimsical in his civilities , ” replied her uncle .
text_tokenized: “ But perhaps he may be a little whimsical in his civilities , ” replied her uncle .

text: “ Your great men often are ; and therefore I shall not take him at his word about fishing , as he might change his mind another day , and warn me off his grounds . ”
text_tokenized: “ Your great men often are ; and therefore I shall not take him at his word about fishing , as he might change his mind another day , and warn me off his grounds . ”

text: Elizabeth felt that they had entirely mistaken his character , but said nothing .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth felt that they had entirely mistaken his character , but said nothing .

text: “ From what we have seen of him , ” continued Mrs. Gardiner , “ I really should not have thought that he could have behaved in so cruel a way by anybody as he has done by poor Wickham .
text_tokenized: “ From what we have seen of him , ” continued Mrs. Gardiner , “ I really should not have thought that he could have behaved in so cruel a way by anybody as he has done by poor Wickham .

text: He has not an ill - natured look .
text_tokenized: He has not an ill - natured look .

text: On the contrary , there is something pleasing about his mouth when he speaks .
text_tokenized: On the contrary , there is something pleasing about his mouth when he speaks .

text: And there is something of dignity in his countenance , that would not give one an unfavourable idea of his heart .
text_tokenized: And there is something of dignity in his countenance , that would not give one an unfavourable idea of his heart .

text: But , to be sure , the good lady who showed us the house did give him a most flaming character !
text_tokenized: But , to be sure , the good lady who showed us the house did give him a most flaming character !

text: I could hardly help laughing aloud sometimes .
text_tokenized: I could hardly help laughing aloud sometimes .

text: But he is a liberal master , I suppose , and _ that _ , in the eye of a servant , comprehends every virtue . ”
text_tokenized: But he is a liberal master , I suppose , and _ that _ , in the eye of a servant , comprehends every virtue . ”

text: Elizabeth here felt herself called on to say something in vindication of his behaviour to Wickham ; and , therefore , gave them to understand , in as guarded a manner as she could , that by what she had heard from his relations in Kent , his actions were capable of a very different construction ; and that his character was by no means so faulty , nor Wickham ’s so amiable , as they had been considered in Hertfordshire .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth here felt herself called on to say something in vindication of his behaviour to Wickham ; and , therefore , gave them to understand , in as guarded a manner as she could , that by what she had heard from his relations in Kent , his actions were capable of a very different construction ; and that his character was by no means so faulty , nor Wickham ’s so amiable , as they had been considered in Hertfordshire .

text: In confirmation of this , she related the particulars of all the pecuniary transactions in which they had been connected , without actually naming her authority , but stating it to be such as might be relied on .
text_tokenized: In confirmation of this , she related the particulars of all the pecuniary transactions in which they had been connected , without actually naming her authority , but stating it to be such as might be relied on .

text: Mrs. Gardiner was surprised and concerned : but as they were now approaching the scene of her former pleasures , every idea gave way to the charm of recollection ; and she was too much engaged in pointing out to her husband all the interesting spots in its environs , to think of anything else .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner was surprised and concerned : but as they were now approaching the scene of her former pleasures , every idea gave way to the charm of recollection ; and she was too much engaged in pointing out to her husband all the interesting spots in its environs , to think of anything else .

text: Fatigued as she had been by the morning ’s walk , they had no sooner dined than she set off again in quest of her former acquaintance , and the evening was spent in the satisfactions of an intercourse renewed after many years ’ discontinuance .
text_tokenized: Fatigued as she had been by the morning ’s walk , they had no sooner dined than she set off again in quest of her former acquaintance , and the evening was spent in the satisfactions of an intercourse renewed after many years ’ discontinuance .

text: The occurrences of the day were too full of interest to leave Elizabeth much attention for any of these new friends ; and she could do nothing but think , and think with wonder , of Mr. Darcy ’s civility , and , above all , of his wishing her to be acquainted with his sister .
